result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan M Ballesteros-Medina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight time.  Sentence Credit for 109 days was granted.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Juan M Ballesteros-Medina in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1 and 3 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
- 5 months jail.  Credit for 109 days.
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
